definition: to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: This rise has been paralleled by an increase in fluid milk intake.
sentences.chinese: 糖尿病发病率的上升是与液体奶摄入量的增加并行的。

sentences.english: Also, try to limit your intake of caffeine and alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 你也要限制你的咖啡因和酒精的摄入量。

sentences.english: How do you feel about counting calories?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么看计算卡路里摄入量？

sentences.english: "The most powerful determinant of your dietary intake is your energy expenditure, " says Steven Gortmaker, who heads Harvard's Prevention Research Center on Nutrition and Physical Activity.
sentences.chinese: 决定饮食摄入量的最大因素是你的能量消耗。

sentences.english: Calcium and other nutrients intakes we re assessed by a food-frequency method.
sentences.chinese: 钙和其它营养素摄入量用食物频率法评价。

sentences.english: Keep a count of your calorie intake for one week.
sentences.chinese: 把你一星期的热卡摄入量记录下来。

sentences.english: With adequate water intake your body will be able to metabolize fat more effectively.
sentences.chinese: 有了充足的水摄入量你的身体就可以代谢脂肪更有效。

sentences.english: And also recommended the suitable absorbtion quantities of edible vinegar.
sentences.chinese: 还推荐了食醋的适当摄入量。

sentences.english: The sweets do not have to be eliminated from your diet completely, but you should have them well under control.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中不能缺少糖份但是摄入量必须得到控制。

sentences.english: The daily recommended amount, according to government nutrition experts, is 6 g.
sentences.chinese: 由政府的营养专家建议的每日摄入量是6克。

sentences.english: Keep a of your calorie intake for one week.
sentences.chinese: 把你一星期的热卡摄入量记录下来。

sentences.english: Limitation of water intake and therapy for adding salt are safe and effective in the treatment of hyponatremia.
sentences.chinese: 限制水摄入量和适当补钠是安全有效的治疗方法。

sentences.english: The recommended daily intake of fiber is 35g.
sentences.chinese: 推荐的纤维每天摄入量是35克。

sentences.english: Sugar intake has gone up, too, by about 30 pounds per person per year.
sentences.chinese: 糖摄入量也上升到每人每年约30英镑。

sentences.english: Simple ( endemic ) goitre , the most common, is due to low iodine intake.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的甲状腺肿是由于碘的摄入量不足。

sentences.english: The intake of vegetable in the Korean-Chinese and Han nationality is lower than Chinese Dietary Guidelines.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜族和汉族老年人蔬菜摄入量明显低于推荐量。

definition: to absorb (nutrients etc)/to assimilate/intake/to take a photograph of (a scene)
